title: Tiny Chinese Chip Hacks U.S. Companies, Opportunities in Digital REITs, The Messy Middle
itunes:title: Tiny Chinese Chip Hacks U.S. Companies, Opportunities in Digital REITs, The Messy Middle
description:
Joel Weber, Bloomberg Businessweek Editor, discusses the Businessweek magazine cover story about a computer hack by Chinese spies reached almost 30 U.S. companies, including Amazon and Apple. Craig Gordon, Bloomberg News Washington Bureau Chief, explains where the investigation of Brett Kavanaugh stands and a potential Senate committee vote on his confirmation on Friday. Gary Wojtaszek, CEO at Cyrus One, talks about the growth in investing in digital real estate investments trusts. Scott Belsky, Chief Product Officer at Adobe, discusses his book "The Messy Middle" about the long journey of startups. And we Drive to the Close of the market with Eric Clark, Portfolio Manager at Accuvest Global Advisors. 

 Hosts: Carol Massar and Jason Kelly. Producer: Paul Brennan 

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
